snippet: Minoo Khaleghi easily won a seat in February’s election but was disqualified over claims she did not wear a head scarf on visits to Europe and China.
abstract: Powerful Iranian state committee, part of Iran's judiciary, rules Minoo Khaleghi cannot be sworn in as new member of Parliament because of photos in which she appeared in public abroad without Islamic head scarf; Khalegi is one of number of independents and reformists elected to Parliament; Khaleghi calls photos fake.
lead_paragraph: Minoo Khaleghi easily won a seat in February’s election but was disqualified over claims she did not wear a head scarf on visits to Europe and China.

headline.main: She Won a Seat in Iran’s Parliament, but Hard-Liners Had Other Plans
headline.print_headline: Panel in Iran Bars Woman From a Seat in Parliament
